Type.Name: GuidAttribute

TypeSignature.Value: .class public sequential ansi sealed beforefieldinit GuidAttribute extends System.Attribute

Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the <link location="node:gtk-sharp/programming/threads">Gtk# Thread Programming</link> for details.

Attribute.AttributeName: System.AttributeUsage(System.AttributeTargets.Assembly | System.AttributeTargets.Class | System.AttributeTargets.Struct | System.AttributeTargets.Enum | System.AttributeTargets.Interface | System.AttributeTargets.Delegate | System.AttributeTargets.All, Inherited=false)

remarks.para: You can apply this attribute to assemblies, interfaces, classes, enumerations, structures, or delegates, although the [<topic://cpgrfTypeLibraryImporterTlbimpexe>] can apply it for you when it imports a type library.

The string passed to the attribute must be in a format that is an acceptable constructor argument for the type . To avoid conflicts with the type , use the long name explicitly. Only use an explicit GUID when a type must have a specific GUID. If the attribute is omitted, a GUID is assigned automatically.

summary.para: Supplies an explicit when an automatic GUID is undesirable.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string guid) cil managed

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified GUID.

Docs.value: To be added: an object of type 'string'
